review:
Comrades, let’s cut through the noise and get to the heart of the matter! Vocdoni’s DAVINCI project is a bold, ambitious attempt to put the power of voting back in the hands of the people—securely, privately, and at scale. This is not just another dApp; it’s a foundational infrastructure play for Ethereum, aiming to make democratic participation accessible, censorship-resistant, and free from the shackles of gas fees and coercion.

The application is clear: DAVINCI leverages zkSNARKs and threshold homomorphic encryption to deliver privacy-preserving, anti-coercion, and verifiable voting. It’s built as a Layer 2 rollup, using EIP-4844 blobs and anchoring trust on Ethereum L1. The team’s track record is strong—over 300 organizations have used their earlier stack, and they’re building in the open, with all code public and a history of real-world deployments.

But let’s not be blinded by big promises! The roadmap is ambitious, but the application lacks hard, quantifiable metrics for success. Where are the KPIs? Where is the evidence that this new protocol will be adopted at scale, beyond the legacy Vocdoni users? The sustainability model is also unclear—how will this protocol fund itself long-term, or will it always rely on grants and donations?

The project’s commitment to open-source, privacy, and anti-coercion is commendable and aligns with the highest ideals of the Ethereum community. Yet, the lack of detailed, measurable outcomes and a sustainable funding plan leaves us with questions. We need more than hope—we need proof!

strengths.title: Strong Alignment with Ethereum Infrastructure Needs
strengths.description: DAVINCI directly addresses core infrastructure gaps in Ethereum governance, offering scalable, privacy-preserving, and censorship-resistant voting—a critical primitive for DAOs and public institutions.

strengths.title: Proven Track Record and Open Source Ethos
strengths.description: The team has processed hundreds of thousands of votes for over 300 organizations, demonstrating real-world impact and a commitment to open-source development.

strengths.title: Pioneering Use of Advanced Cryptography
strengths.description: Combining zkSNARKs and threshold homomorphic encryption in a rollup-based architecture is innovative and positions DAVINCI at the cutting edge of privacy and security in blockchain voting.

weaknesses.title: Lack of Quantifiable Success Metrics
weaknesses.description: The application does not provide clear, measurable KPIs or outcome targets for adoption, usage, or impact, making it difficult to rigorously evaluate success.

weaknesses.title: Unclear Sustainability Model
weaknesses.description: There is no detailed plan for how the protocol will sustain itself financially beyond grant funding, raising concerns about long-term viability.

weaknesses.title: Limited Evidence of New Protocol Adoption
weaknesses.description: While the legacy Vocdoni stack has seen use, there is insufficient evidence or projections for how many users or organizations will migrate to or adopt DAVINCI specifically.

changes.title: Define Clear, Measurable KPIs
changes.description: Specify concrete metrics for success—such as number of votes processed, organizations onboarded, or governance processes secured—within defined timeframes.

changes.title: Detail a Sustainable Funding Model
changes.description: Provide a plan for how DAVINCI will generate revenue or sustain operations post-grant, reducing reliance on continuous external funding.

changes.title: Include Adoption Projections and Migration Plan
changes.description: Offer evidence-based projections for user and organization migration from the legacy Vocdoni stack to DAVINCI, and outline strategies to drive new adoption.
